goal.ch:
Upon the completion of this course, your will be able to:
 Challenge your understanding of the concepts and theories in the field of OB
 Appreciate that good managerial skills and decisions are not always intuitive or based on gut-feeling
 Understand the breadth of theory and concept with respect to individuals, groups, and interpersonal processes in a rapidly shifting global business and societal context
 Think critically about applying the concepts and theories presented in the readings/class discussions to solve real organizational issues

outline.ch:
A happy environment leads to better and memorable learning outcomes!
This course aims to create a happy environment to provide you with a comprehensive introduction to the wide range of theory, research, and practice in the field organizational behavior (OB). OB is the study of how individuals and groups impact the behavior within an organization. Because organizations are an integral part of many people’s lives and as a member of organizations, you will encounter issues ranging from the individual level to the group level and the organizational level, and you will need to be aware of how these areas fit into your working life. You will learn in great detail, topics regarding individual behavior such as individual differences and motivation. Topics regarding group behavior include teams and leadership, as well as organizational level topics such as organizational culture.
Throughout the course, I strongly encourage you to think of yourself not only as a hardworking student in this course, but also as a “future leader” in an organization (e.g., job, school, cultural, religious or sport) that you are currently associated with or planning to join after graduation. This will allow you to think critically about the information presented in classes. In other words, try putting yourself in the situation and connect what you learned with materials from other core Finance courses.
